meanings.definition: The state of being collateral; the condition of being parallel or side by side.
meanings.sent1: The collaterality of the two buildings made them look like twins.
meanings.sent2: The collaterality of the train tracks allowed the trains to run smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The collaterality of the two friends' outfits unintentionally made them look like a matching pair.
meanings.sent4: The collaterality of their opinions on the matter was strikingly similar.
meanings.sent5: The collaterality of the trees along the path created a beautiful symmetry.

meanings.definition: The quality of being related or connected in some way.
meanings.sent1: There was a clear collaterality between the two events.
meanings.sent2: The collaterality of their interests brought them closer together.
meanings.sent3: The collaterality of their taste in music made for interesting conversations.
meanings.sent4: The collaterality of their goals aligned perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The collaterality of their family histories was surprising.
